parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
To go in, enter (originally: I shall go in). From eis and eimi; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Abstr: alms-giving, charity; concr: alms, charity. From eleos; compassionateness, i.e. beneficence, or a benefaction.
